attributes.action: Enforce the Hunting Act 2004 & close loopholes that allow illegal Hunting
attributes.additional_details: Despite the Hunting ban being in effect since 2004, loopholes allow illegal Hunting to occur with hounds, the foxes are chased to exhaustion and ripped to pieces whilst alive by hounds. It's a barbaric and an outdated activity that happens despite it being banned. Enforce the ban and close the loopholes to stop allowing illegal Hunting of our wildlife to happen
attributes.background: Enforce the Hunting Act 2004, close loopholes that allow illegal Hunting to occur

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about hunting, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We could accept a petition calling for trail hunting to be banned, but you would need to provide your full name.

Enforcement of bans on hunting is a matter for the police, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Mini’s law - Protect the public and animals from hunting activities: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584076

Ban trail hunts from using more than two hounds: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583761

All Trail Hunt Hounds to be muzzled when released from kennels to public areas: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565516
